p: The use of wild edible plants and their products in human life has grown from ancestral practices [ 53, 55, 56]. This could enhance household food security in wild plants consuming territories, especially in rural areas [ 54]. In Ethiopia, many wild edible plants have been consumed wild which enhances the food security status of households throughout the year. Especially, in the rural areas, there is a culture of consuming wild plants in pastoral, agropastoral, nomadic, and rural areas [ 56, 57].
